entry.title: Payment Protocol Proposal: Invoices/Payments/Receipts
entry.summary: In an email thread from December 6, 2012, Gavin Andresen discusses the implementation of a "pass around" method for Bitcoin transactions. He clarifies that this method would not involve users copying and pasting information, but rather automatic communication behind the scenes. However, another user suggests that the pass-around method should be implemented in addition to transparent protocols. They argue that this method is simpler to implement and still usable by expert users. Additionally, they note that some users or organizations may prefer manual control for important transactions. Overall, there should be both lower-level and higher-level access to Bitcoin transaction functionality.
